â€¢ The progestogen-only pill. If 
you are breastfeeding, you 
can take a progestogen-
only	pill,	which	will	not	affect	
your milk supply. This can 
also be started 21 days 
after you give birth. It has 
to be taken at the same 
time every day. If you start 
it later than the 21st day, it 
will not be reliable for two 
days. So for this time you 
will have to use some other 
form of contraception (like 
a condom) as well. There is
